So much to see! Changgyeonggung Palace, Seoul Tower, the War Museum, the Coex Mall & Aquarium, and The Trick Eye Museum were some of my favorites.
was a regular at the War Memorial in Yongsan when I was stationed there. Seoul was my happy place.
so what are your tips, as a regular?

get a subway card. Go off the beaten path away from the tourists. Take in the sights of the city. Palaces meet skyscrapers in the city I called magical. I’ve rarely felt more at home than I did in Seoul.
the trick eye museum? Sounds fascinating... need to look that one up.

I chose Delta for my prefer airline travel, I also applied for American express Delta thinking that every time I fly with delta I will be getting miles, my surprise was to find out the Delta do not give miles for economy tickets if I choose to fly that way, I have purchased 5 tickets and I cannot believe they will not give me any earn miles because it was economy, I am very disappointed with delta, they need to change that policy, most people fly economy and now I am stuck with the American express delta card since I won't be using it to fly, American airline and United airline honor me basic economy if I choose to fly that way, they will give me earn miles, I hope Delta honor me my flights and fix this horrible policy.
We sincerely apologise for the inconvenience caused.I have already responded to your direct message. Please check so we can continue our conversation there. -Thank you
Well, you already know what my problem is

Hello,we are deeply sorry for making you feel that way, it was never our intention but we would like to closely look at the concern raised. Please DM your reachable number We connect you with an agent who can assist. Thank you

you do get mile for economy tickets. However you don't get them for the deeply discounted Basic Economy tickets. You chose the lowest priced tickets. You don't get the cost saving benefits of a Basic Economy ticket and the perks of a standard economy ticket.

I have not problem if they would said when you apply, that’s the problem, also is not even basic economy because you have to pay for all luggage and carry-on luggage and everything else so what is the savings? They should at least credit miles for it.
get rid of that credit card. It’s completely useless unless you spend thousands of dollars. Not worth it

We sincerely apologise for the inconvenience caused.I have already responded to your direct message. Please check so we can continue our conversation there. -Thank you

thanks for getting back to me but as I said I will take this up with the Australian civil aviation authority. We have already made contact with Delta Air Lines and you have said you can’t help. The way you do your business in Australia is not in the best interest of your customers.

I have received DM from people I don’t know if they are from Delta Air Lines but all I can say for now is people out there DO NOT FLY delta international to Australia and connect with Jetstar Australia because they have not thought through their policies. You will be charged for baggage twice yet it is one ticket purchased through delta from the USA to Melbourne. They two airlines do not talk. You are made to check in at the airport because it’s a delta intentional flight but you will be subjected to Jetstar airlines baggage policies at the airport. If you want to fly to the USA from Australia you are better off flying to Doha or Emirates.

we just got back from Tokyo and I have to say, that was the worst food I have ever tried to eat. The Delta staff in Tokyo were wonderful as my daughter needed help getting off the plane due to a migraine. They were courteous, kind and exceedingly helpful. Not to mention having to get a bus from the terminal to the plane and walking up stairs with all of our stuff. Really? do better Delta. Next time I'll try United.

I went to pull up the email to utilize the e-credit a few days ago and realized it was located on my old computer that had stopped working and I had no access to that email. I made multiple attempts to contact Delta to retrieve the information of my e-credit so that I may use the e-credit towards a trip that my husband and I are taking to Vegas in a few weeks. Imagine my disappointment when I was told that my e-credit was no longer valid. I tried explaining to the Delta Customer service supervisor that when the e-credit was sent to me there was no expiration date. (or I would have used it sooner).

People of Delta Air Lines . I am so furious with you all. I’m at a lot of time that I can’t get back, I have over $1,500 in expenses for a trip that I could not make it on due to Delta Air Lines issues and not that of my own. I spent well over twelve hours yesterday traveling from ATL-MCO and back. Our plane was flooded due to an alleged pipe burst. I could’ve made my cruise if you all were forthcoming considering all I would have had to do was drive by no, there was issue after issue even once we landed in MCO still could have made my trip but we were stuck on the runway due to no gates being available. This is unacceptable and I’m very disappointed in this. I would hope that you all will be compensating me for my expenses as again I’ve paid for something that I could not enjoy due to your errors not mine. I will post receipts if needed. You all need to do better with you handling of customers and ensuring that you are truthful in your responses.

Our flight on 1/4 was delayed so long, our entire day was shot. It was delayed little by little until a new plane was sent in, but doing the math, there is no way Delta did not know that the plane would not take off before at least 10 a.m., meaning most of us would miss our connections. Why, then would Delta not send a new plane right away? We ended up having to rebook TWICE at the gate because of these changes. I can explain the math to a representative when contacted. Also, on our second flight, Delta had the audacity to announce an “early arrival” before we then had to wait 20 minutes on the tarmac for the plane in our arrival gate to load more bags! I couldn’t believe what was happening, it was a nightmare.

you can explain whatever you want to the rep over the phone and you’ll be wasting your time and breath. There is nothing they can do and they don’t even have control over those issues you are describing. So, save your time and the time of the rep. Btw, if you start b*tching, they will hang up.
dear , please forward your complaint to our help-desk inbox here so our customer representatives can attend to you asap, Thanks.

To add to it, my wife doesn’t have U.S. citizenship yet and, on her Thai passport, she couldn’t leave the airport without a visa. So she got to enjoy a full day of airport ambiance—no hotel, no compensation, no help from either airline. A long 50+ hour journey to get from RSW to CNX and the worst part wasn't the travel, it was dealing with bad customer service when asked the simple request, "please help me rebook my flight or at least give me options if I can change my final destination to BKK". As a multi-year Medallion member, this experience didn’t exactly inspire loyalty.

Will not fly with Delta Air Lines ever again. I was on a flight with code share of Korean Airline. I came to the gate for the connecting flight to get to Austin on time so I could be in Austin on the same day(Feb 2nd). However, Delta did not allow me to get on the flight although I checked in advance with a seat. Instead, Delta booked 2 new flights and I had to wait at Seattle for another 8 hours after a long international flight. Just to get to Austin on Feb 3 with a night in Atlanta with no assistance. Worst airline ever.

Delta is a scam they pulled the same scam on me two times in a row claiming oh there's bad weather at the arrival destination we have to delay your flight they deleted three separate times for a total of three and a half hours later causing us to miss our connecting flight which in turn cause them to rebook us on a different flight but put us in the last row of the main cabin although we have a first class ticket for the entire trip and they offer no reimbursement at all. If that wasn't bad enough.. they're doing the exact same scam on the return leg of the trip oh we have to delay the flight now we have to do it again bad weather at the gaining Airport don't worry we'll rebook you and then rebook first class passengers in coach and tell you there's nothing they can do about it because it's the weather is out of their control that's the scam that Delta is now pulling

On September 29, 2024, during my honeymoon, my husband and I were treated with outright hostility at the Boise check-in counter. We arrived within Delta’s 30-minute baggage cutoff, but the agent refused to check us in. Despite us politely informing her it was our honeymoon, she was dismissive, cold, and entirely unprofessional—leaving us feeling judged and unwelcome for being gay. This resulted in us losing our paid upgrades and being forced onto a disgusting 757 in the last row, with broken and unsanitary lavatories.

On September 29, 2024, during my honeymoon, my husband and I were treated with outright hostility and blatant discrimination by a Delta agent at BOI. The agent refused to check us in, despite us arriving within Delta’s baggage cutoff window, and treated us with such disdain that it was clear we were being targeted for being gay. Her actions caused us to lose our paid upgrades and endure a substandard flight in the last row of a filthy aircraft. This violates federal anti-discrimination laws, including Title IX and the Air Carrier Access Act.

Delta is so cute and clever.... I'm in the top 5% of flyers, your send me a cute badge. I fly more this year than last year but I go from Platinum to Gold. I get no roll over, so that tells me this year I will look closely at where I think I will land at the end of the year and when I hit it, I will stop using my card, I will stop flying Delta because all that extra will be for nothing. You have over inflated your miles program so now I will concentrate on my Chase Sapphire, look for the lowest fare and get a much more bang out of mile than using Delta. Thanks for the cute badge, but it means nothing to me. You've destroyed your program so have fun only getting a portion of my business. I'm on the look out for an airline who looks at their customers as partners and then I'm out.
